headline: Does Earnings Beat And Higher Margin Targets Change The Bull Case For Bank of New York Mellon (BK)?
summary: The Bank of New York Mellon Corporation recently reported fourth-quarter 2025 results, with net income of US$1,461 million and diluted EPS of US$2.02, alongside Board approval of a US$0.53 common dividend and a range of preferred dividends payable in early 2026. The company also completed a share repurchase program totaling 44,905,818 shares for about US$4.16 billion and raised its medium-term profitability targets, underlining management’s focus on efficiency, AI-enabled operations, and...

headline: Bank earnings: What else to expect as JPMorgan comes under pressure
summary: While JPMorgan Chase (JPM) kicks off earnings season for Big Banks this week, HSBC Head of US Financials Research Saul Martinez talks about his earnings forecast for other banking institutions this week. Also watch Saul Martinez discuss JPMorgan's latest earnings release and what President Trump's proposed 10% cap on credit card rates could mean for credit lenders. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

headline: Bank of New York Mellon: Q4 Earnings Show Strong Business At Fair Value
summary: Bank of New York Mellon delivered record net income in 2025, driven by digital platform and AI-driven cost efficiencies. Learn more about BK stock here.

headline: BK Q4 Deep Dive: BNY Leverages AI, Expands Digital Offerings, and Raises Margin Targets
summary: Global financial services company BNY NYSE:BK) reported revenue ahead of Wall Streets expectations in Q4 CY2025, with sales up 6.8% year on year to $5.18 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $2.08 per share was 4.9% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: BNY Assets Growth Strengthens Case for Market Optimism
summary: BNY says it works with 92% of the Fortune 100 companies and 94% of the top 100 investment managers worldwide.
